Question.title: Knowledge Check
Question.questionText: If you accidentally forget to tell your reader that you used information from another source, it doesn't count as plagiarims.

answers.feedback: All writiers have a responsibility to be honest and clear with their readers when they have included words, ideas, and/or images from another source. Therefore, plagiarism can be accidental or deliberate.

That's correct! All writiers have a responsibility to be honest and clear with their readers when they have included words, ideas, and/or images from another source. Therefore, plagiarism can be accidental or deliberate.

Question.title: Knowledge Check
Question.questionText: It's not necessary to indicate that you have included information from unpublished sources like class lectures and slides.

answers.feedback: It's necessary to identify the source of all borrowed information, even if it is unpublished.
That's correct! It's necessary to identify the source of all borrowed information, even if it is unpublished.

Question.title: Knowledge Check
Question.questionText: It's not necessary to indicate when you have captured the main idea from another source — only when you have borrowed someone else's exact words.

answers.feedback: You are required to indicate to the reader whenever you have included someone else's ideas, even if you have captured this idea in your own words — called ‘paraphrasing’.
You're right! You are required to indicate to the reader whenever you have included someone else's ideas, even if you have captured this idea in your own words — called ‘paraphrasing’.
